condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Policies and plans are in place to scale up child protection interventions

description.narrative: UNICEF has leveraged humanitarian interventions toward enhancing and strengthening national CP systems and establishing mechanisms to prevent and respond to violence, exploitation, and neglect of children. As part of UNICEF continuous support to the Government of Syria's efforts to enhance the situation of boys and girls, and advance children rights, an inter-ministerial committee was established to work on three major areas: case management, social workforce and a national plan to operationalize the recommendations of the Child Rights Committee about children in Syria. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:19/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of policies, plans and guidelines developed to scale up child protection interventions.
Increased capacity of government key staff and decision makers on social workforce system
Number of analysis and assessments conducted and reports shared
Draft social workforce model for Syria available
